paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Approximately 50% of patients had the Val30Met mutation; 67% had stage 1 disease (ambulating without assistance); 33% had stage 2 disease (ambulating with assistance); 58% previously received Diflunisal or Tafamidis, and 63% had cardiomyopathy.

functional_data.summary: Inotersen reduces levels of both mutated and wild-type TTR, effectively slowing or halting disease progression.

variants.segregation_data: Penetrance is not complete, and there is a large variation in phenotype within genotypes.
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met mutation is endemic in Portugal, Sweden, and Japan, with a large population in Brazil.
key_quotes: Penetrance is not complete, and there is a large variation in phenotype within genotypes.
The most common mutation is Val30Met, where valine is replaced by methionine at position 30 (148G→A).

variants.additional_notes: The Val122Ile mutation is associated with hATTR-CM.
The Thr60Ala mutation is associated with hATTR-CM.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant variants in the TTR gene were extracted, with emphasis on penetrance data.
